text: This 2021 Porsche 718 Boxster GTS 4.0 was purchased new by the seller at Champion Porsche of Pompano Beach, Florida, and was optioned from the factory with the Premium and Sport Chrono packages. Power is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch PDK automatic transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring and a mechanically locking differential. Additional equipment includes a black convertible top, LED headlights with PDLS+, Power Steering Plus, 20″ 718 Sport wheels, heated and ventilated power-adjustable Sport Plus seats, a heated steering wheel, Lane Change Assist, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation. This 982 Boxster was listed on BaT in August 2024 and is now offered again with a window sticker, service records, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in GT Silver Metallic and has LED headlights with Porsche Dynamic Light System Plus (PDLS+) as well as a power-operated black soft top, ParkAssist parking sensors, power-folding mirrors, dual exhaust outlets, and a black-finished speed-activated rear spoiler.

The 20″ 718 Sport alloy wheels are mounted with staggered-width Pirelli P Zero tires. The car is equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM) and Power Steering Plus. GTS 4.0 suspension provides a ride height 20mm lower than the standard model, and stopping power is handled by red-finished Porsche-branded calipers over cross-drilled rotors at each corner.

The heated and ventilated power-adjustable Sport Plus seats are trimmed in black leather and are joined by a color-coordinated dashboard, door panels, and carpets. Porsche-branded floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include Guards Red seatbelts, a Bose sound system, the Light Design Package, Lane Change Assist, a wind deflector, dual-zone automatic climate control, and Porsche Communication Management with navigation.

The heated leather-wrapped steering wheel fronts a central tachometer with a 7,800-rpm redline flanked by a 200-mph speedometer and a configurable information display. Power is routed to the rear wheels through a seven-speed dual-clutch PDK automatic transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring and a mechanically locking differential.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Champion Porsche of Pompano Beach, Florida, along with factory colors, options, and a total price of $102,340.
